sen.j: 孝昭天皇（こうしょうてんのう、懿徳天皇5年（紀元前506年）- 孝昭天皇83年8月5日 (旧暦)（紀元前393年9月5日））は、『古事記』『日本書紀』に伝えられる第5代の天皇（在位：孝昭天皇元年1月9日 (旧暦)（紀元前475年2月21日） - 同83年8月5日 (旧暦)（紀元前393年9月5日））。
sen.e: Emperor Kosho (A.D.506-August 31, A.D.393) was the fifth Emperor, who is described in "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters) and "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan) (Reign: February 16, A.D.475-August 31, A.D.393).

Emperor Kosho (506 B.C. - September 5, 393 B.C.) was the fifth emperor (reign: February 21, 475 B.C. - September 5, 393 B.C.), being described in "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters) and "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan).

Emperor Kosho (506 B.C. - September 5, 393 B.C.) was the fifth emperor (reign: February 21, 475 B.C. - September 5, 393 B.C.), being described in "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters) and "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan).

sen.j: 和風諡号は観松彦香殖稲尊（みまつひこかえしねのみこと）・御真津日子訶恵志泥命（『古事記』）。
sen.e: His Japanese-style posthumous name was Mimatsuhikokaeshine no Sumeramikoto, written as 観松彦香殖稲尊 or 御真津日子訶恵志泥命 ("Kojiki").
sen.cmt: 読み方が同じで漢字が相違していたので、漢字名もそのまま残しました。
sen.e: His Japanese-style posthumous name was Mimatsuhikokaeshine no Sumeramikoto, written as 観松彦香殖稲尊 or 御真津日子訶恵志泥命 (Kojiki).
His Japanese-style posthumous name was Mimatsuhikokaeshine no Sumeramikoto, written as 観松彦香殖稲尊 or 御真津日子訶恵志泥命 (Kojiki).

sen.j: いわゆる欠史八代の一人で、実在しない天皇と捉える見方が一般的である（実在説もある）。
sen.e: He was one of the so called Kesshi-Hachidai (Eight Undocumented Sovereigns), and it is commonly understood that he was the nonexistent Emperor (There is also the theory of his real existence).
He was one of the so called Kesshi-Hachidai (Eight Undocumented Sovereigns), and it is commonly understood that he was a nonexistent Emperor (there is also the theory of his existence).
sen.cmt: The nonexistent Emperor を a nonexistent Emperorに変更。real existenceのrealを除去。
sen.e: He was one of the so called Kesshi-Hachidai (Eight Undocumented Sovereigns), and it is commonly understood that he was a nonexistent Emperor (there is also the theory of his existence).
Imperial Palace
Imperial Palace
Imperial Palace

sen.j: 都は掖上池心宮（わきがみのいけこころのみや。
sen.e: The capital was Wakigaminoike kokoro no miya.
The capital was Wakigaminoike kokoro no miya.
The capital was Wakigaminoike kokoro no miya.

sen.j: 現在の奈良県御所市池之内か）。
sen.e: (That is considered to be present Ikenouchi, Gose City, Nara Prefecture.)
(That is considered possibly to be present Ikenouchi, Gose City, Nara Prefecture.)
(That is considered possibly to be present Ikenouchi, Gose City, Nara Prefecture.)

sen.j: ただし、『古事記』には「葛城掖上宮」とある。
sen.e: However, there is a description n "kojiki" that the capital was "Katsuragi no wakigami no miya."
However, there is a description in kojiki that the capital was "Katsuragi no wakigami no miya."
However, there is a description in kojiki that the capital was "Katsuragi no wakigami no miya."
Achievements
Achievements
Achievements

sen.j: 特に記録されていない。
sen.e: There is no particular description about his achievements.
There is no particular description about his achievements.
There is no particular description about his achievements.

sen.j: 懿徳天皇22年（紀元前489年）2月12日 (旧暦)に立太子、孝昭天皇元年（紀元前475年）1月 (旧暦)に即位した。
sen.e: He was formally installed as Crown Prince on March 25, A.D.489, then ascended the throne in A.D.475.
He was formally installed as Crown Prince on March 25, 489 B.C., then ascended the throne in 475 B.C.
sen.cmt: A.D を B.C. に変更
sen.e: He was formally installed as Crown Prince on March 25, 489 B.C., then ascended the throne in 475 B.C.
He died in the 83rd year of his reign,
He died in the 83rd year of his reign.
sen.cmt: 文の最後をピリオドに変更
sen.e: He died in the 83rd year of his reign.

sen.j: 『日本書紀』に114歳、『古事記』には93歳とある。
sen.e: According to "Nihonshoki", he died at the age of 114, while according to "Kojiki", he died at the age of 93.
According to Nihonshoki, he died at the age of 114, while according to Kojiki, he died at the age of 93.
sen.cmt: Nihonshokiおよび Kojikiから引用符を削除
sen.e: According to Nihonshoki, he died at the age of 114, while according to Kojiki, he died at the age of 93.
Misasagi (Imperial mausoleum)
Misasagi (Imperial mausoleum)
Misasagi (Imperial mausoleum)

sen.j: 掖上博多山上陵（わきがみのはかたのやまのえのみささぎ）に葬られた。
sen.e: Emperor Kosho was buried in Wakigami no hakata no yamanoe no misasagi.
Emperor Kosho was buried in Wakigami no hakata no yamanoe no misasagi.
Emperor Kosho was buried in Wakigami no hakata no yamanoe no misasagi.

sen.j: 現在、同陵は奈良県御所市三室に所在する俗称「博多山」（山形墳）に比定される。
sen.e: Currently, this misasagi is identified with the mountain shaped barrow popularly known as "Hakata no yama", which is located in Mimuro, Gose City, Nara Prefecture.
Currently, this misasagi is identified with a mountain-shaped barrow popularly known as "Hakata no yama," which is located in Mimuro, Gose City, Nara Prefecture.
sen.cmt: the mountain shaped barrow を a mountai-shaped barrowに変更。
sen.e: Currently, this misasagi is identified with a mountain-shaped barrow popularly known as "Hakata no yama," which is located in Mimuro, Gose City, Nara Prefecture.
